subSections.title: Compounds
Etymology
Usage notes
subSections.text: The kanji {{ja-l|絵}} and {{ja-l|画}} (also pronounced ''e'', but can also be pronounced as ''ga''), both having the same meanings and [[音読み#Japanese|on-reading]]s, can be confusing. While {{ja-l|絵}} is used to mean pictures in the "drawn" sense (for example, {{ja-r|挿%絵|さし%え}}, "[[illustration]]"), it can also refer to art in front of the speaker, such as {{ja-r|浮%世%絵|うき%よ%え|[[ukiyo-e]]}} or {{ja-r|蒔%絵|まき%え|[[sprinkle]]d [[lacquer]]}}. {{ja-l|画}} refers to art ''by extension'', for example, {{ja-r|日%本%画|に%ほん%が|Japanese painting}}. Sometimes, both kanji can be interchanged, an example being {{ja-r|影%絵|かげ%え|rom=-}}, {{ja-r|影%画|かげ%-え|[[shadow play]]}}
